rice.description: Rice is a staple food for a large part of the world's human population.

maize.description: Maize, also known as corn, is a cereal grain first domesticated by indigenous peoples in southern Mexico about 10,000 years ago.

chickpea.description: The chickpea or chick pea is an annual legume of the family Fabaceae, subfamily Faboideae.

kidneybeans.description: The kidney bean is a variety of the common bean. It is named for its visual resemblance in shape and colour to a kidney.

pigeonpeas.description: The pigeon pea is a perennial legume from the family Fabaceae.

mothbeans.description: Moth bean is a drought-resistant legume grown in arid and semi-arid regions of India.

mungbean.description: The mung bean is a plant species in the legume family.

blackgram.description: Black gram, also known as Urad dal, is a bean grown in the Indian subcontinent.

lentil.description: The lentil is an edible legume. It is an annual plant known for its lens-shaped seeds.

pomegranate.description: The pomegranate is a fruit-bearing deciduous shrub in the family Lythraceae, subfamily Punicoideae.

banana.description: A banana is an edible fruit – botanically a berry – produced by several kinds of large herbaceous flowering plants in the genus Musa.

mango.description: The mango is a juicy stone fruit produced from numerous species of tropical trees belonging to the flowering plant genus Mangifera, cultivated mostly for their edible fruit.

grapes.description: A grape is a fruit, botanically a berry, of the deciduous woody vines of the flowering plant genus Vitis.

watermelon.description: Watermelon is a flowering plant species of the Cucurbitaceae family.

muskmelon.description: A muskmelon is any of several varieties of melon, Cucumis melo, in the family Cucurbitaceae.

apple.description: The apple tree is a deciduous tree in the rose family best known for its sweet, pomaceous fruit, the apple.

orange.description: The orange is a fruit of various citrus species in the family Rutaceae.

papaya.description: Papaya is the fruit of the plant Carica papaya, a tropical fruit native to Mexico and Central America.

coconut.description: The coconut tree is a member of the palm tree family and the only living species of the genus Cocos.

cotton.description: Cotton is a soft, fluffy staple fiber that grows in a boll, or protective case, around the seeds of the cotton plants of the genus Gossypium.

jute.description: Jute is a long, soft, shiny bast fiber that can be spun into coarse, strong threads.

coffee.description: Coffee is a brewed drink prepared from roasted coffee beans, the seeds of berries from certain Coffea species.
